game

Class Pyramid

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Pyramid

  • public class Pyramid
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) ApproachableTile approachableTile
      approachableTile is the coordinates of empty tiles that the player can play on.
      (package private) boolean isLeft
      isLeft is a boolean to know at which side the player wanted to add his tile.
      (package private) Tile[][] pyramid
      pyramid is a pyramid of tile with a base of 9, it's represent the K3.
      (package private) Tile[][] sidePyramid
      sidePyramid is a list of 10 tiles.
      (package private) int sidePyramidIndex
      sidePyramidIndex is a integer that contains the index where the next tile need to be placed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pyramid()
      This constructor initialise every variable, plus put every tile in the pyramid and the sidePyramid as empty or Gray.

    • Field Detail

      • pyramid

        Tile[][] pyramid
        pyramid is a pyramid of tile with a base of 9, it's represent the K3.

      • approachableTile

        ApproachableTile approachableTile
        approachableTile is the coordinates of empty tiles that the player can play on.

      • sidePyramid

        Tile[][] sidePyramid
        sidePyramid is a list of 10 tiles. It represent the case when the K3 is full and the player need to add tile a the left or the right of the K3.

      • isLeft

        boolean isLeft
        isLeft is a boolean to know at which side the player wanted to add his tile. If true it's left, if false is right.

      • sidePyramidIndex

        int sidePyramidIndex
        sidePyramidIndex is a integer that contains the index where the next tile need to be placed. It's also the high of the sidePyramid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pyramid

        public Pyramid()
        This constructor initialise every variable, plus put every tile in the pyramid and the sidePyramid as empty or Gray. And add to approachableTile the coordinates of the tile that is above the pyramid. Also put the sidePyramidIndex to 0, and temporary isLeft to true.

    • Method Detail

      • initPyramid

        public void initPyramid(java.util.List<Tile> tiles)
        This function place the 9 first tiles from a list of tile at the bottom of the pyramid.
        Parameters:
        tiles - is a list of 9 tiles that as at least 4 different color in it.

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk(Tile tile,
                    Coordinates coordinates)
        This function test if the given tile can be placed at the wanted coordinate.
        Parameters:
        tile - that is tested a the coordinate.
        coordinates - the coordinate to test the tile.
        Returns:
        true if the tile can be placed at the coordinate and false if not.

      • add

        public void add(Tile tile,
                Coordinates coordinates)
        This function add a tile to a coordinate in the pyramid.
        Parameters:
        tile - is the tile that need to be placed.
        coordinates - is the wanted coordinate to placed the given tile.

      • initSidePyramid

        public void initSidePyramid(boolean isLeft)
        This function is the first time when the pyramid is full.
        Parameters:
        isLeft - is a boolean to represent the side of the pyramid.

      • addSidePyramid

        public void addSidePyramid(Tile tile)
        This function add a tile to the sidePyramid if the pyramid is full.
        Parameters:
        tile - is the tile that need to be placed.
